subject: VMED
title: Financial Planning
info: Principles/practice of farm/personal finance, interpreting financial statements, calculating financial return, setting goals, budgeting, analysis of decision making, time value of money, comparisons on investments, portfolio diversification, analysis of risk, impact of asset allocation.

subject: VMED
title: Prob Dis Cont Erad
info: Past and present disease control and eradication programs; factors influencing success and failure. Development of models for programs in the United States or a foreign country for group evaluation and analysis.

subject: VMED
title: Prob Vet Epi PHlth
info: Individual study on problem of interest to epidemiology or public health student.

subject: VMED
title: Diag Epi of Infectious Disease
info: Theoretical principles, practical applications of diagnostic testing in populations. Examples related to infectious diseases in veterinary/human health. Basis of test performance, limitations, interpretations.
prereqInfo: prereq: Statistics course or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Seminar: Vet Epi
info: Each student leads at least one seminar. Reviews of current research, literature reviews, and technique development. Students and participating faculty participate in presentation, discussion, and administration of the seminars.
prereqInfo: prereq: Veterinary Medicine grad student

subject: VMED
title: Dir Studies - Pop Med
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
title: Basis of Nanoparticle Toxicity
info: Use of nanotechnology in scientific research. Impact of nanomaterials on biological systems.

subject: VMED
title: Surveillance Foodborne Disease
info: Principles/methods for surveillance of foodborne diseases.  Investigation of outbreaks. Assessment of food safety hazards. Focuses on integration of epidemiologic/lab methods.
prereqInfo: prereq: [PUBH 5330, [professional school or grad student]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Ecology of Infectious Disease
info: How host, agent, environmental interactions influence transmission of infectious agents. Environmental dissemination, eradication/control, evolution of virulence. Use of analytical/molecular tools.

subject: VMED
title: Spatial Analysis Infec Dis Epi
info: Spatial distribution of disease events. Exposures/outcomes. Factors that determine where diseases occur. Analyzing spatial disease data in public health, geography, epidemiology. Focuses on human/animal health related examples.
prereqInfo: prereq: Intro to epidemiology, statistics,

subject: VMED
title: Molecular Bio Pub Health Prof
info: This course focuses on introducing students to molecular biology lab tools that are used to investigate infectious diseases in public health settings.  The course combines laboratory sessions during which students will learn and run molecular assays with computer lab sessions during which students will analyze molecular data.

subject: VMED
title: Effective Science Comm
info: Skills needed to research, organize, develop, and deliver an oral scientific presentation or to assist in finding, compiling, and organizing information for presentations, theses, or papers suitable for publication.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student

subject: VMED
title: Dairy Financial Decisions
info:
Concepts/tools of economic analysis needed to support decision making on dairy farms, particularly as those decisions relate to health, disease impact, nutrition, general farm management.
Prereq Earned DVM, instr consent.

subject: VMED
title: Dairy Production Medicine
info: Intense eight week course designed to develop advanced knowledge/skills in dairy production medicine. Mixture of lectures, wetlabs, farm investipations, presentations. Held at Dairy Education Center at New Sweden Dairy.
prereqInfo: prereq: DVM degree, instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Large Animal Physiology I
info: Review of large animal physiology at level needed for specialty board certification or beginning research. Students present topics in physiology and supplement reading with clinical case material or journal articles.

subject: VMED
title: Large Animal Physiology II
info: Large animal physiology for specialty board certification or beginning research. Students present topics in physiology and supplement reading with clinical case material or journal articles.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent; 5210 recommended

subject: VMED
title: Large Animal Diagn Ultras
info: Fundamentals of diagnostic ultrasound in large animal patient. Ultrasonography of the equine limbs/joints, large animal abdomen/thorax. Lectures, lab.

subject: VMED
title: Clin Vet Derm Path
info: Microscopic pathology of basic dermatologic reactions and of variable disease states.
prereqInfo: prereq: DVM degree or foreign equiv

subject: VMED
title: Adv Small Animal Patho I
info:
Biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine of disciplines relevant to companion animals. Pathogenesis/treatment of diseases. Developing hypotheses that can be translated into clinical research.
Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equiv] degree.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Small Animal Patho II
info:
Overview of biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine of disciplines. Underlying pathogenesis/treatment of diseases of companion animals. Developing hypotheses that could be translated into clinical research.
Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equiv] degree.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Small Animal Patho III
info:
Overview of biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine. Underlying pathogenesis/treatment of diseases of companion animals. Developing hypotheses that could be translated into clinical research.
Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equivalent] degree.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Small Animal Patho IV
info:
Overview of biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine. Underlying pathogenesis/treatment of diseases of companion animals. Developing hypotheses that could be translated into clinical research.
Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equiv] degree.

subject: VMED
title: Urinary System Disease
info: Expands on disorders of small animal urinary system. Introduction to core and to additional disorders.

subject: VMED
title: Indep Study Vet Med
info: Arranged independent study in a clinical area of veterinary medicine.

subject: VMED
title: Dir Studies - Comp Med & Patho
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
title: LA Clinical Medicine/Surgery
info: Hospital cases using standardized format, audiovisual aids. Review literature pertaining to case. One or two cases presented by enrolled participants per month.
prereqInfo: prereq: VMed grad student, possess DVM

subject: VMED
title: Topics in Vet Clinical Patho
info: Modified rounds format. Cases from VMC used to explore cytology with associated chemistry/hematology data. Attendees/clinicians can request lab topics for dicussion. Past topics have included lab measurement of chemical analytes, test sensitivity or specificity (e.g., ethylene glycol test, FELV test), lab testing for infectious agents.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student in CVM

subject: VMED
title: Veterinary Gross Pathology
info:
Diagnosing gross lesions of tissues. Evaluating images from wide variety of animals submitted to lab. Mock exams. Students prepare two in-depth reviews on topics covered during in course.
Prereq Grad student in CMB or [VMED, [DVM degree or foreign equivalent], college consent]

subject: VMED
title: Adv. Vet. Systemic Path I
info: Students review/summarize topics in systemic pathology using veterinary pathology textbooks and relevant updates from pathology and veterinary medical journals. Diagnostic cases in alimentary, respiratory, urinary, cardiovascular, and hematopoietic system pathology. Students give 10-15 presentations with handouts for other students.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student in VMED or [CMB, [DVM degree or foreign equiv]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Adv. Vet. Systemic Path. II
info: Students review/summarize topics in systemic pathology using veterinary pathology textbooks and relevant updates from pathology and veterinary medical journals. Representative diagnostic cases in endocrine, reproductive, musculoskeletal, nervous, special senses, and integumentary system pathology. Student give 10-15 presentations with handouts for other students.

subject: VMED
title: Veterinary Descript. Histopath
info: Weekly, one-hour microscopic slide prsentations, reviews on wide variety of diseases in domestic/non-domestic animals.  Students present microscopic slide cases and prepare discussions about disease entities, differential diagnoses, and ancillary tests.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student in VMED or [CMB, [DVM degree or foreign equiv]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Vet Diagnostic & Comp Patho
info: Diagnostic skills in gross/microscopic pathology. Students participate in necropsy services of veterinary diagnostic lab, examine carcasses from variety of animals. Case write-ups, interpretation of gross/microscopic lesions done under supervision of faculty pathologists. Students assist in supervision of veterinary students on senior necropsy rotation.

subject: VMED
title: Prob in Vet and Comp Pathology
info: Case material in Veterinary Diagnostic Lab. Students investigate pathogenesis/epidemiology of selected disease condition or case-related problem agreed upon with faculty pathologist.

subject: VMED
title: Scientific Writing & Speaking
info: Techniques of writing/publishing papers/theses. Manuscript preparation. Submission/review process. Proofreading. Publishing processes. Grant Writing. Oral/poster presentations at sceintific meetings.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student in health sciences

subject: VMED
title: Molecular Epidem Infec Dis
info: Impact, application, and interpretation of molecular techniques in understanding etiology, transmission, and control of infectious diseases important to animal and public health. Theoretical/practical aspects of molecular biology methods in context of epidemiological studies of infectious diseases, including bacterial/viral infections of veterinary/zoonotic significance. Population and evolutionary genetics of pathogenic microorganisms. Data analysis/interpretation. Design of descriptive/hypothesis-driven epidemiological studies involving molecular techniques.
prereqInfo: prereq: Basic course in microbiology

subject: VMED
title: HIV/AIDS: Patho, Treatm, Preve
info: Exposure to pathogenesis, treatment, and prevention of HIV/AIDS from clinical faculty who are dealing with AIDS patients. Developing new questions and design experiments that have greatest chance of translating to clinical setting.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student

subject: VMED
title: Using Risk Analysis Tools
info: This applications-based course will provide the necessary risk-based tools to evaluate and mitigate the microbial and chemical risks in a food production chain-from the farm until consumption.  Students will follow the risk analysis process as an integral part of  science-based decision-making to estimate and manage food safety risks. Students will apply different qualitative and quantitative tools by using a computer.

subject: VMED
title: Quant Mthds Popltn Health
info: This course reviews the principles and application of advanced methods for analysis of population health data, with a focus on animal health and infectious diseases. Analytical techniques that will be taught and applied during the course include risk assessment, spatial analysis, disease modeling, and disease economics.

subject: VMED
title: One Hlth & Infec Dis Wildlife
info: The course will explore the applied concept of One Health and infectious diseases of wildlife in weekly case studies. In each case study, students will gain an understanding of system dynamics, infer the interplay between humans, animals and the environment in the context of a given wildlife disease, and confront current disease management practices and challenges for successfully mediating transmission and spread.

subject: VMED
title: Dir Studies - Inf Dis
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
title: Training in Swine Prod. Mngmt.
info: Production module introduces techniques/protocols for swine production system operation. Research module covers applied research trials for viral/bacterial pathogens in pigs.
prereqInfo: prereq: VMED grad student or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Biohazard Vet Med
info: For veterinary medicine graduate students who expect to assume supervisory responsibility for design and safe operation of laboratories in veterinary research, teaching, regulatory, or commercial institutions.

subject: VMED
title: Research Veterinary Medicine
info: Independent study as determined by instructor. Usual activity includes conducting research in instructor's lab, though research in field may also be included.
prereqInfo: prereq: Jr, instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Swine Dis Diagn
info: Review of recent advances in swine diseases; farm visits for on-farm disease diagnostics and control programs.

subject: VMED
title: Companion Animal Oncology
info: Principles of veterinary oncology. Biologic behaviors, treatments, and prognosis of neoplastic disorders.

subject: VMED
title: Prin Veterinary Anesthesiology
info: In-depth training in principles of veterinary anesthesiology. Lectures, anesthesia labs, presentations by students.
prereqInfo: prereq: VMed grad student, [DVM degree or foreign equiv], instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Bovine Surgery Practicum
info: Intensive training in ruminant surgery. Evaluation of food animal surgery principles, hands-on laboratory components.
prereqInfo: prereq: [VMed grad student, [DVM or equiv foreign degree]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Ind Res Vet  Anesthesiology
info: Independent research supervised by faculty member.

subject: VMED
title: Dir Studies - SRA
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
title: SA Orthopedic Radiology
info: Roentgen signs of common bone diseases of small animals.

subject: VMED
title: Lag Anim Ortho Rad
info: Roentgen signs of common bone diseases of large animals. Emphasizes the horse.

subject: VMED
title: Food Prod, Proc, Sply Chain
info: Food commodities and agricultural crops play critical roles relevant to public health, energy and economic vitality, feeding the increasing global human population, and providing multiple outputs from feed for animals, to fuel for vehicles, transportation and energy. This course focuses on agricultural commodities. For 2019 we will focus on corn and dairy production systems in Minnesota. The commodity of interest will change from year-to-year to other commodities like pork and sugar beets – which provide critical outputs for the state of Minnesota.

subject: VMED
title: Dir Studies - Therio
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
title: Vet Pub Hlth Learning Exper
info: Part of the curriculum for the master's degree includes an opportunity for students to develop a written document detailing applications of public health practice. Completion of the ILE allows students to synthesize aspects of public health into a document that can be utilized by public health professionals.

subject: VMED
title: Application of Vet Pub Hlth
info: The APEx, applied practice experience provides students an opportunity to learn first-hand about the organization, operations, and special activities of selected agencies, institutions and industries concerned with public health practice. This is a means of gaining additional insight into public health programs, personnel management, governmental relations, public relations, legislative support and, particularly, knowledge of special investigations or responses conducted by these organizations. Participation in the activities of public health practice programs external to the University adds a dimension of experience to the curriculum that enriches the student's training and may be beneficial in seeking employment.

subject: VMED
title: Grantwriting
info: Components of a strong proposal. Grant submission process.  What reviewers look for. How to locate grant announcements that match research interests.

subject: VMED
title: Essential Stats for Life Sci
info: This course is a broad overview of the principles and methods of statistical analysis used in life sciences research, including biological, veterinary, and translational research, and provides the background a new researcher needs to understand and apply commonly used statistical methods and the preparation needed for more advanced coursework.
prereqInfo: Classes will include general instruction and background information, detailed examples of how to perform the analyses, with actual data sets, and discussion on how the topic has been applied in biological research, including reading and assessing papers in the field. Computing will be performed using the R software environment, though students may use alternate software with permission.

subject: VMED
title: Food Defense: Prep, Rspd, Rcvr
info: Basic principles of preparedness/emergency response. Instructor may substitute topics if timelier topic arises.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad or professional student or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Food Defense Awareness
info: Protecting your Lunch: Food Defense Awareness presents current issues, challenges, concerns, and activities impacting global food defense. \"Food Defense\" is the sum of actions and activities related to prevention, protection, mitigation, response, and recovery of the food system from intentional acts of adulteration and disruption. This includes intentional acts from both terrorism and criminal activities. This topics course incorporates case studies as well as current events that directly relate to food system disruption, cause food supply chain interruption, or may provoke intentional adulteration or food fraud.

subject: VMED
title: AMR: One Health Perspective
info: Fundamentals of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) development, transmission, and risks to humans, animals, and the environment delivered by experts in the One Health concept (interconnection between people, animals, plants, and their shared environment). Review and development of research-based resources and methods for communicating scientific information to non-academic audiences. Multi-institution collaboration with online engagement during class meetings.

subject: VMED
title: Intro to Applied Health Policy
info: This course introduces students to policy analysis and leadership tools to navigate the complexities of policy-making and foster policy dialogue and action. We will apply a health lens to discuss contemporary policy issues, explore the different stages of the policy cycle, map the polarities of complex challenges, and apply implementation science techniques to guide policies from theory to impact. May be of particular interest to graduate students in the academic health sciences or HHH/OLPD.
prereqInfo: prereq: Graduate or professional degree in-progress or completed.

subject: VMED
title: Vet Public Practice Seminar
info:
Interactive review of current public practice topics in 
environmental health/toxicology, infectious/parasitic diseases, public health administration/education, epidemiology and biostatistics, and food safety.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Clinical Epi
info: An in-depth focus on infectious disease epidemiology, with opportunities to apply epidemiologic principles to control infectious diseases in animal populations.

subject: VMED
title: Ldrshp to Addr Global Grand Ch
info: In this 5-day skills-based course, participants will learn and apply integrative leadership (also known as shared or facilitative leadership) strategies for addressing global grand challenges. Using global food system challenges as a basis for exploration, we will focus on leadership practices that foster collective action across diverse groups of people.

subject: VMED
title: Intro to Teaching Skills
info: This is a hybrid series of modules and face-to-face course sessions, and experiential learning guiding veterinary students through best practices to enhance efficacy as an instructor in a veterinary curriculum. Specific topics include learning theory, building a course session, teaching presentations, and individual student assessment.

subject: VMED
title: Veterinary Public Prac Seminar
info: Interactive review of current public practice topics in infectious and parasitic diseases, epidemiology and stats, food safety, environmental health, and toxicology.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Sw Dis
info: Lectures and discussion on advances in diseases of swine.

subject: VMED
title: Swine Production Systems
info: Swine production systems.  Design, construction, staffing, pig flow, and financial aspects.

subject: VMED
title: Swine Nutrition
info: Nutritional principles and concepts in swine nutrition.

subject: VMED
title: Swine Records
info: How to interpret data from computer health management program.

subject: VMED
title: An Hlth Fd Sys Policy Intergov
info: Evidence-based policy development. Relevant global animal health and food system issue. Role of scientific evidence in developing/implementing policy and in intergovernmental organization's policy development. Policy-making process as it pertains to trade, animal health, and food system across intergovernmental organizations.

subject: VMED
title: An Hlth Fd Sys Policy Ntnl Gov
info: Evidence-based policy development for a global animal health and food system issue. Visits to Washington, DC. Interactions with key leaders from various organizations/agencies. Integrating skills in animal health, public health, communication, and food security with national/international animal health policy.

subject: VMED
title: An Hlth Fd Sy Policy State Gov
info: Policy-making process as it pertains to animal health, public health, and food systems at the state and provincial levels. Global animal health, public health, and food system issue with a particular emphasis on the interplay of science, politics and belief in developing and implementing policy associated.

subject: VMED
title: Engaging Intergovernmental Org
info: How to engage intergovernmental organizations in global policy development for trade, capacity building, and development. Students develop a network of contacts in organizations to access additional reference materials, understand who to contact for specific issues. Intergovernmental organizations: World Trade Organization, World Health Organization, World Organization for Animal Health and Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Impacting veterinary public health domestically/globally.

subject: VMED
title: Epi Zoonoses
info: Major human zoonotic diseases, methods of transmission, diagnosis, control, and prevention.
prereqInfo: prereq: Epidemiology and infectious disease course or instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Ethical Conduct/An Research
info: Ethical considerations in use of animal subjects in agricultural, veterinary, and biomedical research. Federal, state, and University guidelines relating to proper conduct for acquisition/use of animals for laboratory, observational, epidemiological, and clinical research. Regulatory requirements. Bases for proper conduct. Societal impact on scientific investigations utilizing animal subjects.

subject: VMED
title: Dairy Hlth Mngmnt: Crit Think
info: Group discussions surrounding critical evaluations of scientific journal articles and dairy-related scientific presentations. Facilitated by both students and faculty.

subject: VMED
title: Welfare of Farmed Animals
info: This course covers topics on the evaluation and assessment of the welfare of farmed animals. Literature review, discussions, and analyses are used to increase skills needed to evaluate methods for improving the welfare of farmed animals in various situations.

subject: VMED
title: Food Safety, VPH
info: Includes presentations and discussions on on-farm HACCP principles and prudent use of antibiotics.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Sm An Vet Med
info: Discussions of diseases of organs or systems in animals, including degenerative, psychological, anomolous, metabolic, nutritional, neoplastic, immune, inflammatory, toxic, and traumatic disorders.

subject: VMED
title: Int Med Sm Anim
info: Lectures, assigned readings, and discussions on internal medical problems of dogs and cats.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Dx Rx Anim Dis
info: Detailed examination, treatment, and discussion of naturally occurring disease in patients admitted to Veterinary Medical Center.

subject: VMED
title: Seminar Vet Med
info: Participation and presentations of regularly scheduled seminars about internal medicine.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Nephr/Uro Clin
info: Clinical investigation of naturally occurring urinary diseases in patients admitted to Veterinary Medical Center.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Med Conf
info: Participation in weekly conference about internal medical disorders.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Acid-Base, Lytes
info: Clinical problems and physiology of acid-base, electrolyte, and fluid disorders of dogs and cats.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Journ Club: Lrg Anim Int Med
info: Students/faculty keep abreast of current literature in large animal internal medicine. Students critically evaluate the literature.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Adv Stu Neph/Uro
info: Studies of urinary tract disease with goal of generating new knowledge.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Res Nephrol/Urology
info: Individual research on selected problems

subject: VMED
title: Adv Lg An Vet Med
info: Discussions of diseases of organs or systems in animals in a clinical setting.

subject: VMED
title: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: VMED
title: Evidence Based Med
info: Concepts of evidence-based medicine with emphasis on veterinary clinical evidence will be presented. Clinical questions, development of study designs, identification of literature and assessment of the impact of the literature on clinical decisions.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Vet Clin Skills Teach & Pract
info: This course involves directed work in the best practices for general veterinary clinical teaching and specific veterinary clinical skills teaching, and applying those practices in teaching laboratories for 1st, 2nd and 3rd year veterinary students. It is intended for U of MN graduate students who have a DVM or equivalent degree and  will potentially  be involved in clinical teaching of DVM students in their future career plans.

subject: VMED
title: Vet Clin Skills Lab Teaching
info: This course involves directed work in the best practices for general veterinary clinical teaching and specific veterinary clinical skills teaching, and applying those practices in teaching laboratories for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd year veterinary students. It is intended for U of MN graduate students who have a DVM or equivalent degree and  will potentially  be involved in clinical teaching of DVM students in their future career plans. There are 9 required laboratory teaching sessions as assigned by the laboratory instructor in the spring and for any semesters as determined in consultation with the student about their areas of knowledge and interest for teaching clinical skills.

subject: VMED
title: Med Conf
info: Medical, surgical, or obstetrical cases supported by anatomic, bacteriologic, pathologic, physiologic, pharmacologic, and radiologic evaluations whenever applicable.

subject: VMED
title: Research Vet Med
info: Research problems relating to any aspect of internal medicine or to the various systems in animals.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Diag An Dis
info: Detailed examination, discussions, and treatments of cases of animal diseases in a clinical setting.

subject: VMED
title: FTE: Doctoral
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: VMED
title: Sem: Inf Dis SwMed
info: Students, faculty, and guest speakers present seminars on current research in diagnosis, control, and treatment of infectious diseases.

subject: VMED
title: Res Infect Dis
info: Directed research.

subject: VMED
title: Prob Infect Dis
info: In-depth discussion on specific problems for various infectious diseases of farm animals.

subject: VMED
title: Translational Animal Models
info:
This course will be taught by experts who have successfully developed or utilized translational animal
models of human diseases. An overview of comparative and translational research will be presented and
discussed including a comparison of naturally occurring vs experimental models of diseases. We will
review 12 animal models and use them as examples to discuss the challenges faced during model
development, relevance of the selected models to other animal species and humans, and the
advantages/disadvantages of each animal model. Strategies to determine when an animal model is
appropriate for a given application will be discussed. During this course each participant will develop and
present their own idea of a translational animal model (naturally occurring or experimental) in their area
of research interest.
The class will be alternate each week between the participating institutions. It will be held in person by
the hosting institution and participants from other institutions and will participate via Zoom or another
online platform. The instructor will generally be located at the host institution and will participate in
person at that school, but occasionally instructors will participate remotely via Zoom.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Immunol
info: Lectures and case presentations.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Sw Dis
info: Lectures and discussion on advances.

subject: VMED
title: VMED Seminar
info: Seminar. Exposure to research activities of CMB and VMED students and faculty. Students prepare/present a 20 minute seminar on their original research.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student

subject: VMED
title: Research & Literature Vet Med
info: A combination of literature review, group discussions and analyses are utilized to improve participants' capacity to critically evaluate scientific journal articles. Scientific research presentations will be led by students or faculty.

subject: VMED
title: InfDisJnlsCritRead
info: This course is intended to discuss published papers, experimental methods, approaches, diseases and animal health problems with the goal of promoting critical thinking. Students will be responsible for identifying, reviewing and sharing relevant material as well as leading discussion of their assigned class meeting.

subject: VMED
title: AdvVet Virol/Serol
info: Discussion and laboratory practice.

subject: VMED
title: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
info: tbd
prereqInfo: prereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: VMED
title: AdvVetCritCareEmer
info: Discussions of current topics, focusing on literature and research results in periodicals, proceedings, texts.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Sm An Surg
info: Advanced techniques and procedures.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Lg An Surg
info: Surgery of various systems in large animals, with preoperative and postoperative evaluation and management.
prereqInfo: prereq: DVM or equiv degree, instr consent

subject: VMED
title: G.I. Surg
info: Advanced techniques and problems.

subject: VMED
title: Surg Phys
info: Discussions on pathophysiology of surgical diseases in dogs and cats.

subject: VMED
title: NeuroSurg
info: Advanced neurosurgical diseases of small animals amenable to surgical treatment.

subject: VMED
title: Thor & CV Surg
info: Advanced thoracic and cardiovascular diseases of small animals amenable to surgical treatment.

subject: VMED
title: Plast & Recon Surg
info: Advanced techniques in conditions of small animals.

subject: VMED
title: New Tech Lg An Sx
info: New techniques in large animal surgery.

subject: VMED
title: Urogen Surg
info: Advanced techniques in treatment of small animals.

subject: VMED
title: Res: Lg An Surg
info: Independent research projects.

subject: VMED
title: Sem Sm An Surg
info: Discussions of problems and case analysis.

subject: VMED
title: Sem: Lg An Vet Sx
info: Discussion of current literature and surgery board preparation.
prereqInfo: prereq: DVM or equiv degree, instr consent

subject: VMED
title: Res Vet Surg
info: Research in small animal surgery.

subject: VMED
title: Prob in Lg An Surg
info: New techniques and procedures in large animal orthopedic surgery.

subject: VMED
title: ResCritCare/EmerMed
info: Special problems course. Controlled study; prospective and retrospective models of evaluation are defined, critiqued, and used for experimental design and data collection to validate research methods.
prereqInfo: prereq: DVM or equiv degree

subject: VMED
title: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)
prereqInfo: prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]

subject: VMED
title: Av Crit Care
info: Procedures and protocols for managing avian medical emergencies such as starvation, toxicities, respiratory failure, and massive trauma.
prereqInfo: prereq: Course each in vet pathology, physiology, pharmacology, anatomy, small animal anesthesiology and critical care

subject: VMED
title: SEM: Adv Vet Anes
info: Active interaction around topics of advanced anesthesiology in veterinary species.
prereqInfo: prereq: [[CVM 6321, CVM 6322] or equiv], grad student

subject: VMED
title: Adv Vet Abd Imag
info: Applications and discussion of basic principles through emerging techniques.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Vet Thorac Imag
info: Application and discussion of basic principles through emerging techniques.

subject: VMED
title: Vet Thera Rad
info: In-depth discussion of principles, practice, techniques, and complications.

subject: VMED
title: Vet Nuc Med
info: In-depth discussion of principles, practice, techniques, and complications.

subject: VMED
title: SemVetCritCare/Emer
info: Current topics.
prereqInfo: prereq: DVM or equiv degree

subject: VMED
title: Res Av C PP
info: Students conduct medical and surgical procedures involved in management of avian trauma and critical care patients.

subject: VMED
title: Res Vet Anes
info: Research methodology; controlled prospective and retrospective research studies. Collection and analysis of scientific data.

subject: VMED
title: Sem Vet Radiol
info: Current topics in veterinary imaging, veterinary radiation therapy, or specific applications.

subject: VMED
title: Sem: Vet Anes
info: Discussion and presentations; for veterinary anesthesiology and surgery residents and graduate students.
prereqInfo: prereq: [CVM 6321 or equiv], DVM degree

subject: VMED
title: Res Vet Radiol
info: Research into an application, development of an application, or prospective/retrospective study of any aspect of veterinary imaging or veterinary radiotherapy.

subject: VMED
title: Prob Vet Radiol
info: Discussion of problems associated with veterinary imaging or radiation therapy.

subject: VMED
title: Av An Surg
info: Current methods for anesthetizing raptors, psittacine birds, and waterfowl. Lecture and lab on current methods for avian fracture bone fixation.
prereqInfo: prereq: courses in vet anesthesia, vet small animal orthopedics

info: Reading and presentation of selected current research journal articles; critical evaluation of experimental design, methods, and results.

subject: VMED
title: Adv Diag Meth Ther
info: Directed research in methods for studying fertility factors affecting female and male animal reproduction.

subject: VMED
title: Sp Prob in Therio
info: Specialized and directed scientific readings and discussion; allows for individualizing students' graduate programs.

subject: VMED
title: Statistical Principles Rsrch
info: This course is a broad overview of the principles and techniques of research design and methods used in veterinary and translational research, and provides the background a new researcher needs to understand the literature and make good decisions about what is appropriate for their research.
prereqInfo: prereq: entry level graduate stats course or equivalent
